byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says United States will continue Iran nuclear agreement negotiations but cautions that talks will end if tough decisions are not made; remarks come after negotiators failed to meet deadline for submitting nuclear pact to Congress for 30-day review.
lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said that negotiations with Iran over limiting its nuclear program were “making real progress” but were not “open ended.”

headline.main: In Iran Nuclear Talks, U.S. ‘Will Not Be Rushed,’ Kerry Says
headline.print_headline: Kerry Cautions That Talks for Nuclear Deal With Iran Aren’t Open-Ended

snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said that negotiations with Iran over limiting its nuclear program were “making real progress” but were not “open ended.”
